meanings.sent1: The damage to the ancient vase was irreparable.
meanings.sent2: The irreparable mistake cost him his job.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the irreparable situation only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The irreparable crack in the foundation threatened the stability of the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The irreparable loss of her favorite necklace left her heartbroken.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being remedied or made right.
meanings.sent1: The irreparable damage to the old book was heartbreaking.
meanings.sent2: The irreparable consequences of his actions were severe.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the irreparable error only caused more problems.
meanings.sent4: The irreparable loss of the family heirloom left a void in their lives.
meanings.sent5: The irreparable nature of the mistake was evident to everyone.
